page.title: 18Farms in Slyne-With-Hest.
page.content: There are two farms in Slyne-With-Hest, though a number of other farms do own land in the area.Manor House Farm owned by the Hoggarth family,dates back to 1729.Their livestock is mainly cattle, they have a dairy herd for their milk round, a beef herd and a number of bulls.They are an unusual farm for this area in that they have no sheep. They grow hay and silage for animal feed.The Burrow family own Ashton House farm which has a date stone marked 1765 .They have dairy cows, beef cattle,sheep and hens.The dairy cows provide milk,and the hens eggs for one of the milk rounds in Slyne-with-Hest.As well as growing hay and silage for the animals in winter Mr.Burrow uses one field to grow potatoes.
